samples.input: Who created the R programming language?

messages.content: Who created the R programming language?

content.text: R was created by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand in the early 1990s. It was conceived as an implementation and extension of the S programming language. The name "R" comes from the first letter of the creators' first names and also serves as a play on the name of the S language.

R was created by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand in the early 1990s. It was conceived as an implementation and extension of the S programming language. The name "R" comes from the first letter of the creators' first names and also serves as a play on the name of the S language.

samples.input: In what year was version 1.0 of R released?

messages.content: In what year was version 1.0 of R released?

content.text: Version 1.0.0 of R was released on February 29, 2000. This marked the first official stable release of R after its initial development began in the early 1990s by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand.

Version 1.0.0 of R was released on February 29, 2000. This marked the first official stable release of R after its initial development began in the early 1990s by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand.
